II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Resident transported to his bedroom using an unapproved No
technique.
III. METHODOLOGY
07/01/2019 Special Investigation Intake
2019C0219041
07/01/2019 Special Investigation Initiated - Telephone
07/12/2019 Contact - Face to Face. Resident A and staff person’s 1, 2, and 3
interviewed.
08/08/2019 Exit conference.
ALLEGATION: Resident transported to his bedroom using an unapproved
technique.
INVESTIGATION:
Face to face meeting with chief administrator occurred on 07/01/2019. He reports
reviewing an inappropriate transport dated 06/29/2019.
Video of pod 1 dated 06/29/2019 at 08:10PM was reviewed. It shows all residents
inside the pod’s classroom. Resident A is noted to be inside another resident’s
bedroom destroying property. Staff person’s 1, 2 and 3 arrive at the bedroom. Staff
persons 1 and 3 enter the bedroom, whereas staff person 2 stands at the door.
Resident A is observed being escorted out of his bedroom with staff person’s 1 and
3 holding him by both arms. Resident A is observed talking a few steps then
dropping to his knees. Staff continued to escort resident A by his arms to his
bedroom which resident A is dragging his feet. Resident A is placed inside his
bedroom and the door closed for sleep time.
Resident A was interviewed onsite by this writer on 07/12/2019. He reports running
into another resident’s room and began throwing items around. He reports staff
entered the bedroom and that he began spitting, hitting, kicking, and attempting to
bite at staff. He reports being grabbed by both arms and being dragged to his
bedroom for the night.
2

Staff person 1 was interviewed onsite by this writer on 07/12/2019. He reports
being employed by the facility for 15 years and last had updated behavior
management training in 04/2019. Resident A was in another resident’s bedroom
tearing up the room. He and staff person’s 2, 3, and 4 entered the bedroom and
states resident A began spitting at staff person’s 2 and 4. He and staff person 3 held
resident A by the arms and began walking him to his own bedroom. He notes
resident A dropping his dead-weight to the floor and that he and staff person 3
continued to walk him to his bedroom. He states staff person 2 was clearing out
resident A’s bedroom and that resident A was then placed inside his bedroom for the
night.
Staff person 2 was interviewed onsite by this writer on 07/12/2019. He reports being
employed by the facility for two and a half years and last had updated behavior
management training in 04/2019. He states resident A was in another resident’s
bedroom and that staff person’s 1 and 4 were already in the bedroom. He states
resident A was about to start biting staff and that his wrists were secured by staff
person’s 1 and 3. He states resident A was escorted back to his own bedroom and
that resident A’s feet were dragging as he was resisting the transport. Staff person 2
states a resident being dragged is not an approved transportation technique. He
also states that resident A was not supposed to be in another resident’s bedroom
and that the other residents needed to be contained in the classroom during resident
A’s outburst.
Staff person C was interviewed onsite by this writer on 07/12/2019. He reports being
employed by the facility for three months and last had behavior management at time
of his orientation in 03/2019. He reports being called to the pod as resident A was
tearing up a bedroom and that staff person’s 1, 2, 4 were already in the bedroom.
He states resident A started spitting and that staff person 1 told him that they need
to get him to his bedroom. He states both he and staff person 1 grabbed resident A
by the arms and that resident A dropped to the floor and that they continued to pull
resident A by his arms inside of his bedroom. Once inside the bedroom resident A
was released and his door closed for the night.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4159 Resident restraint.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
procedures regarding restraint. These policies and procedures
shall be available to all residents, their families, and referring
agencies.
3

ANALYSIS: Staff continued to transport resident A to his bedroom even after
resident A dropped to the floor. Video surveillance shows
resident A’s feet being dragged on the floor while staff escorts
him to his bedroom while holding onto both his arms. Such
technique is not supported by the facility’s established Handle
with Care behavior management system.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an approved corrective action plan no change to the current license
is recommended.

sir_summary.summary: An investigation into the Calumet Center juvenile facility found that staff members transported a resident to his bedroom by holding his arms and dragging his feet along the floor after he dropped his weight, which violated the facility's approved behavior management system. The incident occurred after the resident was destroying property in another resident's room and became physically aggressive toward staff. The facility is clearly culpable for the violation, as the staff's technique was unapproved and not compliant with established policy, and the administration is required to submit a corrective action plan.
